sections.heading: Overview: Three Directional Patterns
sections.content:
When you do an action FOR someone or someone does an action FOR you, Japanese uses three patterns based on direction:

| Pattern | Direction | Meaning | | ---------- | ----------- | --------------------- | | 〜てあげる | I → Others | I do for them | | 〜てくれる | Others → Me | They do for me | | 〜てもらう | Others → Me | I have them do for me |

手伝ってあげた "I helped (them)" 手伝ってくれた "(They) helped me" 手伝ってもらった "I had (them) help me"

children.heading: Pattern: Verb-て + あげる/やる/さしあげる
children.content:
I do something FOR someone else:

友達を手伝ってあげた "I helped my friend" 弟に本を読んであげる "I'll read a book to my younger brother" 先生に説明してさしあげました "I explained to the teacher" (honorific)

children.heading: Structure
children.content:
Doer + は + Recipient + に/を + Verb-て + あげる

私は友達に英語を教えてあげた "I taught English to my friend" 母が妹に服を作ってあげた "My mother made clothes for my younger sister"

children.heading: Politeness Variations
children.content: 手伝ってあげる (casual) 手伝ってあげます (polite) 手伝ってやる (very casual, can be rough) 手伝ってさしあげる (honorific)

children.heading: Warning: Can Sound Condescending
children.content:
Using 〜てあげる too much can sound like bragging:

Sounds pompous: 教えてあげたんだよ ⚠️ Better: 教えたよ ✓ "I taught (them)"

Use it naturally, not to show off your kindness!

sections.heading: 〜てくれる - Others Doing FOR Me

children.heading: Pattern: Verb-て + くれる/くださる
children.content:
Someone does something FOR ME:

友達が手伝ってくれた "My friend helped me" 母が料理を作ってくれた "My mother cooked for me" 先生が教えてくださいました "My teacher taught me" (honorific)

children.heading: Structure
children.content:
Doer + が + (me/us) + に + Verb-て + くれる

友達が(私に)英語を教えてくれた "My friend taught me English" 先生が推薦状を書いてくださった "My teacher wrote a recommendation letter for me"

children.heading: Often Used for Gratitude
children.content: 来てくれてありがとう "Thanks for coming" 手伝ってくれて助かった "Your help really saved me" 覚えていてくれて嬉しい "I'm happy you remembered"

children.heading: Politeness Variations
children.content: 手伝ってくれる (casual) 手伝ってくれます (polite) 手伝ってください (imperative - please) 手伝ってくださる (honorific)

sections.heading: 〜てもらう - Having Someone Do FOR Me

children.heading: Pattern: Verb-て + もらう/いただく
children.content:
I have/get someone to do something FOR ME:

友達に手伝ってもらった "I had my friend help me" 先生に説明していただきました "I had my teacher explain" (humble) 母に作ってもらった "I had my mother make it"

children.heading: Structure
children.content:
Receiver + は + Doer + に + Verb-て + もらう

私は友達に英語を教えてもらった "I had my friend teach me English" 弟は姉に宿題を手伝ってもらった "My younger brother had our older sister help with homework"

children.heading: Used for Requests (Potential Form)
children.content: 手伝ってもらえますか？ "Can you help me?" (Can I have you help me?) 説明してもらえる？ "Can you explain?" (casual) 教えていただけますか？ "Could you teach me?" (humble)

children.heading: Politeness Variations
children.content: 手伝ってもらう (casual) 手伝ってもらいます (polite) 手伝っていただく (humble) 手伝っていただきます (polite humble)

children.heading: Same situation, three perspectives:
children.content:
I help friend (〜てあげる):

私は友達を手伝ってあげた "I helped my friend" Focus: My favor to them

Friend helps me (〜てくれる):

友達が私を手伝ってくれた "My friend helped me" Focus: Their favor to me (gratitude)

I have friend help (〜てもらう):

私は友達に手伝ってもらった "I had my friend help me" Focus: I received help (my benefit)

children.heading: Use 〜てあげる when:
children.content:
You're the one doing the favor Talking about helping others Third person helps another

私が教えてあげた "I taught (them)" 母が作ってあげた "My mother made it (for someone)"

children.heading: Use 〜てくれる when:
children.content:
Someone does something for you Expressing gratitude Appreciating someone's action

友達が教えてくれた "My friend taught me" ありがとう、来てくれて "Thanks for coming"

children.heading: Use 〜てもらう when:
children.content:
You receive a favor You request someone to do something Focus on your benefit

友達に教えてもらった "I had my friend teach me" 手伝ってもらえますか？ "Can you help me?"

children.heading: Example 1: Helping
children.content: A: 昨日手伝ってくれてありがとう "Thanks for helping yesterday" B: いいよ、また困ったら言ってね "No problem, tell me if you need help again" A: 今度何か手伝ってあげるよ "I'll help you with something next time"

children.heading: Example 2: Request
children.content: A: ちょっと手伝ってもらえる？ "Can you help me a bit?" B: いいよ、何？ "Sure, what is it?" A: この箱を運ぶの手伝って "Help me carry this box"

children.heading: Example 3: Gratitude
children.content: A: 先生が推薦状を書いてくださいました "My teacher wrote a recommendation letter for me" B: よかったですね "That's great" A: 本当に感謝しています "I'm truly grateful"

children.heading: Casual Requests
children.content: 手伝ってくれる？ "Will you help me?" (using くれる) 手伝ってもらえる？ "Can I get you to help?" (using もらう)

children.heading: Polite Requests
children.content: 手伝ってくれますか？ "Will you help me?" 手伝ってもらえますか？ "Could you help me?" 手伝っていただけますか？ "Could you help me?" (humble)

children.heading: Very Polite Requests
children.content: 手伝ってくださいますか？ "Would you help me?" 手伝っていただけますでしょうか？ "May I ask you to help?"

children.heading: Teaching
children.content: 教えてあげる - I'll teach (them) 教えてくれる - (They) teach me 教えてもらう - I have (them) teach me

children.heading: Making/Cooking
children.content: 作ってあげる - I'll make (for them) 作ってくれる - (They) make for me 作ってもらう - I have (them) make for me

children.heading: Explaining
children.content: 説明してあげる - I'll explain (to them) 説明してくれる - (They) explain to me 説明してもらう - I have (them) explain to me

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong direction with あげる
children.content: Wrong: 友達が私に教えてあげた ❌ Right: 友達が私に教えてくれた ✓ "My friend taught me" あげる is for giving OUT, not receiving!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Overusing てあげる
children.content: Sounds pompous: いろいろ教えてあげたんだよ ⚠️ More humble: いろいろ教えたよ ✓ "I taught various things"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong particle
children.content: Wrong: 友達を手伝ってもらった ❌ Right: 友達に手伝ってもらった ✓ "I had my friend help me" もらう uses に for the doer!

children.heading: Mistake 4: Confusing くれる and もらう
children.content: Both correct but different nuance: 手伝ってくれた "(They) helped me" (gratitude focus) 手伝ってもらった "I had (them) help me" (benefit focus)

children.heading: くれる vs もらう
children.content:
Both mean someone did something for you:

〜てくれる - Emphasizes their kindness:

友達が教えてくれた "My friend (kindly) taught me" Feels grateful, appreciative

〜てもらう - Emphasizes your benefit:

友達に教えてもらった "I had my friend teach me" More neutral, factual

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 〜てあげる / 〜てやる 〜てくれる 〜てもらう

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 〜てあげます 〜てくれます 〜てもらいます

children.heading: Honorific/Humble
children.content: 〜てさしあげる (giving up) 〜てくださる (receiving from above) 〜ていただく (receiving from above)

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 友達を手伝ってあげた "I helped my friend" 母が料理を作ってくれた "My mother cooked for me" 先生に説明していただいた "I had my teacher explain"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 弟に宿題を教えてあげました "I taught my younger brother his homework" 友達が駅まで送ってくれた "My friend took me to the station" 先生に推薦状を書いてもらった "I had my teacher write a recommendation"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 困っている友達を助けてあげたい "I want to help my friend who's in trouble" みんなが応援してくれたおかげで成功できた "I succeeded thanks to everyone's support" 専門家に詳しく説明していただけますか？ "Could I have the expert explain in detail?"
